TopicTitle: [HIRING!][NEW] German Aeronautics and Spaceflight Engineers Kerbin

Articles.Content:
This is the worst German ever. Ask me in the future. Also german is a pretty bad language for this (every gramatically correct sentence with the same meaning sounds awful for the german ear), stick with english.

okay, sorry, I'm trying to learn but im very, VERY new at it. So there's no good translation for "deal with it"?

okay, sorry, I'm trying to learn but im very, VERY new at it. What would be a better translation for "deal with it"?

Uhm well German is just not as "cool" so actually we use those words and phrases too. But "Leb' damit!" is the best translation. But its not even almost as badass as the english version.

Okay, so remember that 93 ton VTOL I made and posted here. Well I scaled it up x2..... This thing is gonna put GASEK on the map!

She is 193 tonnes fully fueled, and even at that weight she can carry 300 tonnes of cargo easily

32 lift engines, 2 horizontal engines. 24,000L of jet fuel (which is about 6 hours of fuel time w/o payload)

Edited November 7, 2014 by zekes

can we add some kind of door/ramp in the back so we can actually use the space in the fuselage? It seems sad to waste it, this thing could haul so much cargo....

That is one of the problems I was unhappy with, but I have no idea how to do something like that, I know its possible to make doors using docking ports that undock and pivot open, but i think it would be extremely hard because of the shape of the fuselage.

Another problem is, that the tail and nose houses all the fuel (to balance out) so it would throw the planes mass completely of center and make the plane dive (due to the center of lift being of) making it darn near impossible to take off let alone fly.

That is one of the problems I was unhappy with, but I have no idea how to do something like that, I know its possible to make doors using docking ports that undock and pivot open, but i think it would be extremely hard because of the shape of the fuselage.
